snippet: A proposed federal rule, announced on Thursday, opens the latest front in the long-running campaign to curb unwanted exposure to secondhand tobacco smoke.
abstract: Housing and Urban Development Dept rule currently being considered would ban smoking in all public housing, as part of effort to reduce harmful secondhand smoke; critics say ban infringes on personal rights and would be impossible to enforce.

byline.contributor: Emily Palmer and Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A proposed federal rule, announced on Thursday, opens the latest front in the long-running campaign to curb unwanted exposure to secondhand tobacco smoke.

headline.main: Public Housing Nationwide May Be Subject to Smoking Ban
headline.print_headline: Public Housing May Be Subject to Smoking Ban
